name: tailscale
description: Easiest, most secure way to use WireGuard and 2FA

repo.name: tailscale
repo.description: The easiest, most secure way to use WireGuard and 2FA.

readme.summary: Clear overview and installation info, but severely lacks usage examples, configuration guidance, and troubleshooting help for end users.
readme.top_issue: No quick start guide or examples showing how to actually use Tailscale after installation (e.g., connecting devices, creating networks, basic commands)

injection_risks.description: The use of exec.Command with user-provided arguments (flag.Arg(0) and flag.Args()[1:]...) can lead to command injection attacks.
The use of os/exec.Command with user-provided arguments (cfg.ProxyTargetIP, cfg.TailnetTargetIP, etc.) can lead to command injection attacks.

critical_findings: Potential secrets exposure through environment variables in cmd/containerboot/main.go
security.summary: The Tailscale codebase has some security concerns, including command injection vulnerabilities and potential secrets exposure, but overall it appears to be well-structured and secure.

common_complaints: Android app functionality regressions (split tunneling broken in v1.92.3)
Platform-specific bugs affecting connectivity and network configuration
Missing features on mobile platforms (widgets, command-line app split tunneling)
Complex DNS and routing configuration limitations
Hardware compatibility issues (UPnP router spam on MikroTik)
praise_themes: Product quality and reliability praised ('excellent product')
Feature richness and core functionality valued
sentiment.summary: Active community with engaged users reporting real bugs and feature requests, but recent regressions in critical Android features and unresolved multi-year enhancement requests (multi-tailnet support since 2020) indicate moderate maintainer capacity relative to user expectations.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being very recent (2026-01-10)
Zero merged PRs in past 6 months indicating no active development
Zero closed issues in past 6 months despite 4113 open issues
No active contributors in past 6 months
Large backlog of 4113 open issues with no recent triage
Unknown last release date suggests release process is stalled
positive_signals: Last commit timestamp is very recent (2026-01-10)
No open PRs indicates project is not accepting new work
maintenance.summary: Project appears stale with recent commit activity but zero development activity, issue resolution, or releases over the past 6 months, suggesting the repository may be archived or dormant.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The README provides a good overview of the project, but lacks clear installation and usage instructions.
concerns: Docs: Lack of clear quick start guide and troubleshooting documentation
Security: Command injection vulnerability in cmd/addlicense/main.go
Security: Potential secrets exposure through environment variables in cmd/containerboot/main.go
Security: The use of exec.Command with user-provided arguments (flag.Arg(0) and flag.Args()[1:]...) can lead to command injection attacks.
